comment: Yes. But doesn't water consumption reduce cellular Na+ and K+ concentration needed for the NaK pump used for muscle contraction? Which would mean water toxicity causes death by reducing the levels of electrolytes, not increasing them, which was the original claim: " interrupting normal brain function caused by abnormally high levels of electrolytes."
